title.narrative: Rupsha 800-Megawatt Combined Cycle Power Plant Project

description.narrative: The project targets improving energy security in Bangladesh. It will increase availability of efficient and cleaner energy by developing a state-of-the-art power plant with 800-megawatt (MW) generation capacity using cleaner and highly efficient power generation technology. The project also envisages the construction of associated natural gas supply and power transmission infrastructure facilities, as well as strengthening of the institutional capacity and overall business process of the project's executing agency, North-West Power Generation Company Limited (NWPGCL), to efficiently plan and operate power plants.

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President
Reports and Recommendations of the President
Enterprise resource planning system for NWPGCL implemented and operational
